CatDescriptText: Mr. Thomas Grace, high school student, 2411 Glen Mawr Rd., McKee[s] Rocks, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Federal Government should provide financial aid for students of exceptional ability to further their education when the students are unable to do so for themselves?" answer reads: "Yes. If the student has the ability he should have he chance.  Otherwise, he or she will grow up and will not have the advantages that others will have."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thomas Grace wearing sweater with striped trim and light colored double breasted overcoat with woven leather buttons, standing in front of flecked granite wall
